notes: Type V-63 with Cadillac's first V8 engine (1923-1925). Introduced 90-degree V8 replacing inline engines. Multiple body styles. Mechanical brakes, 6-volt electrical. Difficulty modifier 1.3 reflects early 1920s brass-era proximity, first-generation V8 technology, hand-fitted components, and extreme parts scarcity. Data sourced from Wikipedia Cadillac Type V-63 article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Series 314 luxury sedan (1926-1927). Continued V8 engine development. Multiple coachwork styles. Mechanical brakes, brass/nickel trim. Difficulty modifier 1.3 reflects mid-1920s complexity, brass-era proximity, hand-assembled construction, and extreme parts scarcity. Data sourced from Wikipedia Cadillac Series 314 article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Series 341 with larger V8 (1928-1929). Introduced synchromesh transmission for 1929 (industry first). Safety glass standard. Multiple luxury body styles. Mechanical brakes transitioning to mechanical with vacuum assist. Difficulty modifier 1.25 reflects late-1920s vintage, transition technologies, and very limited parts availability. Data sourced from Wikipedia Cadillac Series 341 article, December 19, 2024 revision.

LaSalle companion brand (1927-1940). Styled by Harley Earl, positioned below Cadillac. Various V8 engines through production. Multiple body styles. Became Cadillac Series 52 briefly. Discontinued 1940. Difficulty modifier 1.25 reflects 1920s-1930s vintage, companion brand rarity, multiple engine variations, and parts scarcity. Data sourced from Wikipedia LaSalle automobile article, December 19, 2024 revision.
